poem:
### The Dome and the Gavel

In golden reflections,  
a nation's armor gleams,  
while beneath,  
unseen hands join,  
binding in defiance.  
A gavel falls,  
echoing in silent halls—  
the clamor of voices,  
each thread woven,  
resisted unraveling.  
China watches,  
as whispers turn  
the gears of empire,  
unseen and real.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China ‘seriously concerned’ over Trump’s Golden Dome defense system – live 2.08pm BST US judge nixes treasury's bid to cancel IRS workers' union contract A federal judge has rejected a bid by the US treasury department to cancel a union contract covering tens of thousands of IRS staff, Reuters reports, in an early blow to Donald Trump’s efforts to eliminate collective bargaining rights for many federal workers. US district judge Danny Reeves in Lexington, Kentucky,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
